_50_EbRIHSrZKhqlvoYG9g.text: This may not be the best Mongo Bongo I have ever had but it is the best in PHX. The staff is always nice and helpful and you don't like the meal, well you made it, try again.  It is not cheap but reasonable for what you get. I drag my friends there once and they always want to go back.  Give it a shot you wont be sorry.

SBkfcqyqDvcOA_plQnZfRg.text: This is a family favorite. The buffet style allows everyone to choose their own ingredients- lots of choices of different meats, vegetables and sauces. Great way to get the kids to eat lots of fresh vegetables. The staff is very friendly and willing to assist you with preparing sauces if you have not done it before. Watching the chefs cook the food in front of you on the large grills is fun.

photos.caption: Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States

cqOYB2tZn5aCVTDYzpwo3A.text: Got here around 7pm, the cashier got to us fast, asked if we knew what to do, and we were on or way to snag some yummy Mongolion Grill food!!!  There wasn't a long wait in line to grab food, or a long wait for them to cook your food! The resturaunt is clean, and the interior is roomy and doesn't feel cramped. They have vanilla, chocolate, or the vanilla chocolate swirl froyo in a cup or cone included with your meal.  The on on McClintock can't compare, but they are usually backed up with families. Since this location is a little more "hidden" you can enjoy a quiet night with family or friends while you enjoy your meal :)

ySwt7sQuTKjDqtVKqMCEEQ.text: so good and lots of varieties to put in your bowl. all you can eat soup, rice and crackers with refill drinks. very well worth the price!

wgHsO72EdY1-u0b_OOP5EA.text: I have always been a fan of YC's.  I wrote a nasty review and I was personally contacted by the owner who apologized and wanted to make it up to us.  We went back to the same YC's and were amazed at the impeccable customer service.  We had someone helping us every step of the way!  The food is always great!  We didn't experience any integrity issues this time.  :)  I recommend anyone to go here if you have a great appetite.

QSp0Br4m9FZZAMmJde79Gw.text: This place blew our expectations out of the water! On our trip to ikea tonight, my husband and I were planning to go to Genghis grill since it was nearby but they were closed. I found YC'S on yelp and it had good reviews. My husband was leary when we first walked in because there was no one at the counter. The super nice waitress/hostess was helping a couple of first timers (like us) with their selections. She was very nice and showed us the ropes and even mixed the sauce up for me. The portions were HUGE! My husband who usually can eat his full meal had to throw in the towel halfway because it was too much food. We both have hearty lunch portions to take to work tomorrow. The soup bar was excellent especially the wontons. For only $23 they provide you such a great 3 course meal. They even had swirl cones for dessert. The hostess made sure we enjoyed our meal the whole time and even let us have free to go boxes since it was our first time. She even threw in a small box so I could take wonton chips. The customer service was excellent and the food was fantastic. I definitely recommend this location!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Our large portions!

UPeiOAfGKcUZNn2_wlgSGg.text: YCs if the food didn't taste well you seasoned it wrong. How can you not love this place.

868GtSA1PSAn_uo9i1uHjQ.text: Absolutely loved it. Finally Mongolian Bbq that gets it right. You walk in and you're greeted by friendly staff, at least I have on both visits this past week. You decide if you want the small or large bowl and whether or not you want a return trip to the grill. If you do it right, you only need one trip but its really good so if you're really hungry or want to overindulge by all means pay the extra buck something and go for two.   Fill your bowl with the meat, vegetables, & sauces of choice, pressing the contents of your bowl down with the supplied wax paper sheet to get all you can in the bowl as it'll condense greatly on the grill. They have recipes on the board you can copy or create your own. A staff person can help you create it if you have questions. Hand to the guy at the grill and he'll mesh all the flavors together, and hand it back to you steaming hot. Grab some spicy beef soup (taste like egg drop with beef bouillon with some kick to me) and you're all set. Free yogurt cone (dinner only) tops it off nicely.

yd58QffN9hXtCHqmKC2RSQ.text: Always get a box to go immediately because I get so much food. Quality seems decent but hey as a college you can't go wrong. You pick all the ingredients and they have a board with all the recipes that they offer. I like to full a separate bowl for sauces that way I can really stuff my bowl because once again IM cheap and most of us go here to pile up as much as possible. Also check out the jalapenos and pineapples by the cook line, if you haven't tried it its worth a stop.

uin4jGpsoIVs-aSCf7yLug.text: I'm so happy that I found a good Mongolian grill!  I used to go to them all the time when I lived in Washington and I was worried I wouldn't be able to since I moved.  I actually went her on accident, I couldn't find the place I had been planning on going to so I went here instead.  That turned out to be a very good idea.  It's only about $10 and you can go through the buffet as much as you like, there's a couple different soups you can get, drinks and an ice cream machine too.  The bowls for the meats and veggies are HUGE!  It was nice being able to fit everything I wanted into the bowl the first time and not having to make multiple trips.  They have a very large variety of sauces and a sort of menu of how many spoonfulls of each different flavor you need to make specific sauces (orange sauce, teriyaki, etc.).  The staff was all friendly and made sure that everyone knew how it worked and gave recommendations for the sauces.  The guys grilling the food were really fast too, not that I would mind if it was slow since it's so much fun watching them cook everything.  The food itself was sooo good!  I don't know if it was the mixture of sauces I used or  the noodles or what but it was better than the other Mongolian restaurants I'd been to before.  I'm definately going to be returning here although next time it will be on purpose!

Qu4-lzaI1vJ2WMfPXHIFeQ.text: As far as Mongolian BBQ places go, YC's is pretty damn good if you pick the right combination of sauces.  Basically, you can get a bowl for 10.75 or you can pay an extra dollar and get all you can eat. It really depends how you feel. You can try different varieties of sauces and just get small portions throughout or you can pack it into one bowl and hope that you pick the right sauce that you like.  I got the all you can eat because... it's only a dollar more. I ended up getting only two bowls worth, but I honestly don't miss that dollar.   They offer a variety of meats - beef, chicken, pork and fish. I was really disappointed that they didn't have lamb because most places I've been to do. They also have a good amount of vegetables. I usually add bean sprouts, celery, spinach, onions (lots and lots of onions), mushrooms and scallions. Sauces - LOOK AT THE BOARD. I guess some people miss it, but they give you a good number of combinations you can do to make the type of sauce you want. Curry, orange, thai, sweet and sour, mongolian, etc etc. I got the X-pao which basically is a mongolian sauce with a kick. I added some hot chili oil to put in some more, but I like spicy food. I really liked the X-pao, definite recommendation.  On the side, they offer some rice, soup and some wonton chips with sweet and sour sauce. Drinks and dessert (ice cream) come with the meal. Grab it and enjoy! (Only warning is that this place is greasy... as all mongolian bbq places I've been to are, so go in there knowing that!)

QBxvOFY60od8W9cmsuZ02A.text: Every time I go to YC''s I always have a great experience. Service is great, food is good, place is always clean! The price is the best because it's not expensive but the food is awesome. Making your own sauces is a fun experience also.

DXJk1LIkDNWgvsbeW7HXQQ.text: You pick the meat, veggies and sauce... They cook it... You enjoy.  Super friendly. Always clean. Even my children like to eat their veggies here. Highly recommend.

cO_FBWb6976RblS8JU7SIQ.text: Man have I missed this place, and was glad to see they are still open.  I used to go to the one at metrocenter a LLLLLOOOOONNNNNGGGGG tome ago, so I was psyched to find this one out near where i was staying.  I have to say it was even better than i remembered.  Keep up the good work YCs!

bSVxrnEL5mqv2sUEC-plLw.text: I'm really bummed, Yelpers.  I spent a solid 8 years in New York City where, shockingly, they don't have Mongolian BBQ of any kind.  I might as well ask for a unicorn as much as ask someone for Mongolian BBQ.  Growing up, we used to go to this exceptional place in Virginia Beach called the Genghis Khan that was the benchmark for all of my subsequent mongolian BBQ experiences.  It was all you can eat, fresh, tasty and came with delicious soup and this crazy homemade sesame bread (I know - sounds weird from an Asian restaurant, but this bread recipe was super authentic to the region, apparently).  Long story short, my idea of Mongolian BBQ is apparently a far cry from YC's.  Don't get me wrong - the meat and veggies are fresh, the place is super clean and the service is quick.  But shouldn't all of that be a given?  The myriad sauce options are a bit overwhelming if you don't know what you're doing (I was ok saucing for myself, but my husband was confused - good places have a person whom you tell how you'd like it and then sauce for you).  Since the place isn't all you can eat, if you mess up your sauce on the first go, you're stuck with your dish.  Major bummer.  In addition, the whole concept of cramming as much food into a bowl as possible with wax paper and strategizing on how to get the most bang for your buck is really off-putting.  Shouldn't you be able to try different things, graze and casually eat without having to think out your choices like a friggin' game of chess?  Or have to worry about getting a doggie bag for later?  YC's should be a game show the way people scramble to fit as much as they can in a bowl.  The soups are odd - seemingly leftovers from the buffet mixed with broth and then called "wonton" or "spicy beef".  The crispy noodles were stale and tasted of used oil.  We didn't even bother with the frozen yogurt.  A friend who's lived here all his life heard of my search for good Mongolian BBQ and responded "Why?  It's horrible."  I was kind of shocked given that a) he's a good eater and food critic and b) all of my collective experience having Mongolian BBQ up to my going to YC's had been so very good.  I just didn't understand.  Now I'm wondering if YC's is the area's benchmark for which all Mongolian BBQ should be compared to, maybe I should just give up.  It's just not that good at all, and this coming from the girl who'd break off both sets of arms and legs to have even a decent bowl of Mongolian BBQ at this point.  No fair, YC's. No fair.

O34D5dBFLPcDgzdpPq8E2Q.text: Too bad I can't select less than 1 star. Where do I start, first of all there is an "Up-charge" for things like eggs and shrimp. So I guess you better know how many eggs you want before you pay for your all you can eat bowl. Second there is no way to taste test any of the sauces, the girl actually told me I could put some in a small bowl, taste it with my fingers and then she would give me a wipe to clean my hand so I can taste the next one. Third, why in the world would you put your noodles on the line instead of behind the grill, just to fill the bowl up quicker? For some reason the sodas are included, which is no bonus for someone that drinks water. Wonder why the bottom of your bowl looks like soup, watch the guy cooking the food throw water on it and cook for like 30 seconds.  The selection is small, the quality is low, the service is poor. Don't waste your time or your money.

Krgk6RMefJVsuMfgRAPFDw.text: This is good mongolian for a chain-like restaurant.  I have been here a fews times and I was very happy with the service, and freshness of the food!  I'll be back again. Oh be sure to fill your sauce bowl up to about 3/4 so you selection of flavors dont get watered down.

x0Le028tXLWZCT2oyCXtvQ.text: Lots of variety. Yummy sauces to mix. Excellent staff. Great prices

lu1petKaPP0T_7hgApKZRw.text: How could you not like this place? You know what you like so you make your dish EXACTLY how you want it. The staff gets an A+ for being friendly and helpful.  I'd recommend piling as much as you can onto your plate when picking through the buffett line.  They give wax paper out at the beginning of the line to help compress the food prior to cooking.

QVbYKUqWt6nKV6vXcBPgcQ.text: I go here with my pals from my Camaro Car Club when we're at the Pavilions and its a great place to grab some grub and chow down. The staff is very friendly and they keep the place hopping. Good food for the price and the next thing you know you've got a hot plate of food and cooked in front of your very eyes. Way to go YC's! I'm definitely a fan that's for sure and look forward to seeing you again soon!

br8ScR8LAmW3LQhFG4vBdQ.text: Went in to this restaurant for lunch, unaware that it specialized in health foods. I'm not typically one to watch what I'm eating, and I'm not a huge vegetable fan. That being said, I was pleasantly surprised by the abundance of ingredients and choices. The chicken was super tasty and the vegetables that I chose blended perfectly with the garlic sauce I picked. The cashier was very helpful and gave us a tour of the ingredients to choose from. The only thing I wish they had was more standard options, like lo mein noodles, orange sauce and ginger roots. Even though it's healthier fare, I had also wished that they had a normal soy sauce along with their low sodium soy sauce. Other than that, I would say this is the perfect restaurant for a quick and healthy lunch or dinner.

X5APTDCF9XeVvxrW78YlyQ.text: Meh. I love YC's, normally, but this location sucked. They staff seemed pretty careless and didn't really know how to help patrons in their restaurant. They didn't pay any attention to the food bar either. My wife had to go grab an employee to let them know that a bunch of the food was out, including noodles, which is an essential part of YC's dining. It also wasn't very clean around the bar, at the drink station or in the restrooms. You would think that spending $50 would at least get you a clean place to eat. I won't be returning again and I'm pretty turned off from my normally weekly YC's visits as a whole.

TFATYjHPcXfG-_3TMCgzDw.text: The cleanliness here is incredible. The staff are constantly working to wipe, stock, cook, check on customers, and help each other out. I have been to fine dining restaurants with service that couldn't compare. The food is fresh, and the options are plentiful. My husband and I went during the lunch rush today and, were in and out with full bellies in 45 minutes, AND we took our time. The prices are great, too.

POx6X7AgCVRXGYVDZcRhjw.text: This place is pretty good. The best part about it is the people who work here. They seriously didn't stop the whole time we were there. And when I'm sure I looked like a deer in the headlights looking at all the sauce, a girl ran over to help me.   They give you (and this is where my Cali girl voice comes out) hella sauce! If you like a lot of sauce, this is your place. I'm not much of a saucy person. Next time, I'll likely use less.   Otherwise, this is a pretty standard Mongolian BBQ spot. You can pack a whole lot of food into that bowl. Lots of additions you can add also. Price is reasonable. We'll be back.

VR_T4jp5oA_NMCaRI3F5nw.text: Delicious, hot, affordable and filling!   Pro Tip:  Opt for the dinner sized bowl and also buy a to go container too.  Then cram as much stuff as you can in your silver bowl before they cook it.  Then fill half of the to go container with rice and pour all your leftovers into the take out container when you are done eating.  Viola!  Ready made lunch for tomorrow.  :)

59iVorVU0gg6Yp9TjG7L_A.text: I thought this place was slightly below average of what I would expect of a Mongolian BBQ.

bpATNZwZOnwpqGcevmidmQ.text: Very disappointed.  The hostess was very friendly and explained the process.  The cook however was not at all interested in customer service.  One trip through for $12 plus change.  Way more expensive than similar set up's that offer more.  Nothing was grilled - only steamed.  While the items were fresh, they lacked flavor.  With all the other choices available, we won't be back.

uT7LjO97NocxyNFxRRnpJw.text: This place is awesome and fun! Pack up a gigantic bowl of all-you-can-choose meats/veg/fish and self pick a mix of sauces , finally looking at Mongolians fried them all! YUM!   Very complacent with the amount and variety of food. :))) This is perfect for a tired and hungry traveller.

Zfb48ISpAkxaa544JPNIHA.text: Stopped here for lunch and am very happy I did. ~$12 for a huge meal which included a drink, rice, soup, and sauces (and free refills). It's a build your own meal kind of place. If you pack the bowl the best you can and have it almost overflowing when you bring it to be cooked, you'll have enough food for your trip and 2 more meals later. Very fresh food with a great variety and friendly service.

SlzxRIe0yeJgegPXJp3mCA.text: I would be giving this 5 stars. However, they recently switched to Pepsi, and as a pregnant woman, that is a huge deal breaker.  Otherwise, the food is good (love the wonton chips!) and it's clean. The service has always been great and fast.  No complaints other than switching to Pepsi. Why YC's??? WHY??????

33rKEx1Kwt-Nn3UxA_vxUA.text: Loved this place for years, food is still great but now it's priced too high for a lunch. I remeber when lunch was $7, now at $12 I cannot afford it, I didn't get a raise

jkbQ8oqk9kW0rU2_czehNQ.text: Wonderful staff was very attentive and the food was delicious!  The veggies were very fresh and the thinly sliced meat, even though it was frozen was delicious once cooked on that awesome grill. I also love that they had green iced tea...actually 4 flavors of iced tea! The decor was better than I expected and very clean.  I went with a relative who's new to the area and got  a coupon for 2 free lunches. We'll go back for sure.

dLusOqMO-WAtV5M4YUBSjQ.text: This place is Awesome. You decide the ingredients and the sauce combination for the stir fry; it's great. It is a regular for my wife and I.

TnIoGFALFLnow6HJf-V8Gw.text: This location has a problem with raising the price and I don't see anything new being offered at all since I've been going here! Child size is now called small and only $1 less and the bowl size is exactly the same they even throw away anything that falls out of your bowl now. Anyways I wasn't very hungry and the orange haired skinny girl said I couldn't share my bowl with my bf and my dad was getting his own bowl. I've been going here forever this is the only time I ever wanted to share

photos.caption: Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Got everything to go while my dad eats because WE CANT SHARE OUR FOOD. And one bowl fits into 2

xnfraTAXoDE0YvNK68Lo9Q.text: There was a Mongolian BBQ place I went to for 20 years and apparently they went out of business. So I've been looking for someplace new to replace it and saw this one while driving around and thought I would check it out. Overall, everything was pretty good. They have a nice selection of veggies, noodles, meat and sauces to choose from. I didn't try any of the soups but my bowl was pretty good. I'm sure I will be back again now that I understand the process a little better and have tried the food.

TmAE9L58a9R4IzmYFMnhAQ.text: This is one of our family favorites when in the mood for a huge flavorful and inexpensive meal.  The food selection is substantial and the quantities are limited only by your skill in filling your bowl.  Suggestion: you can use one bowl for food and another for your sauce if you like - no additional charge.  Start off with meat: chicken (both white and dark are offered), pork, beef and fish.  Pile on the veggies: (little corn on a cob, lettuce, carrots, onions, sprouts and more I can't remember), add noodles (three kinds are offered, I like the wheat) and then create your personal sauce or select from a dozen or so suggested varieties on a big billboard.    A large selection of sodas and several kinds of tea are available at a fountain and rice, soup and chips top off the buffet.  Your selection will be cooked in front of your eyes on a huge hot stove and warning - it stays hot for quite some time so use caution when forking it into your mouth.  What would normally be called wait staff in any other restaurant are very efficient and will assist in food selection or fixing any issue you might have.  They have always been pleasant and helpful when we have dined there.   Two suggestions: buy some take out cartons (50 cents each) when you enter because you will need them.  Even after cooking the food quantity is large and few diners exit without their "Fido bag).  Secondly, leave room for yogurt.  Not just yogurt, Nanci's Yogurt.  The best there is IMHO.  They feature vanilla (my fav), chocolate (wife's fav) and mixed in both old fashioned cones or cups as you prefer.  Note: yogurt is included in the dinner price but is slightly extra at lunch.  They also have senior pricing for us seasoned veterans.  Provided everyone in your large group likes Asian buffets this is the ideal place to eat.  Everyone gets their favorite food and the price is right.  Plus, there is almost always enough to take home so you get at least two meals for the price of one.  The dining room is very large but not very noisy so good place for both adults and kids.

wBtV2u0iMKfN1wD-aLrTiQ.text: Great food and prices. Make your own Stir-Fry and they give you the ability to fit as much in the bowl as possible! Great service and fast!

xKGrrR9HC3EwifVLZKyeDw.text: This place is good but has gotten way too expensive.  We had a small bowl and large bowl which came to about $26. They even charge for take home boxes which is a gimmick because you're most likely not going to finish your food.

N3uMYfxs4cgqWIo-f9BG4w.text: I have eaten there before and I'll keeping eating there. The food and veggies are so fresh. Service is great as they will mix your flavor for the wok. I think the ice cream should be free. Asking a $1.00 for a cup after spending $22.00 for two people for lunch is odd. Regardless, the flavors are fantastic the way everything is cooked. Having a huge selection of drinks is great and the rice selection is a wow. This is a must stop for lunch.

Lvte6Mc8qjScZuFsbW5qOQ.text: I have been going to these places since 1994. It is a good place to get a stir fry that you select the ingredients. Very unique concept. Usually I end up with enough food for 3 meals. The staff will explain how to get the most food for the money.  Prices gave increased over the years but the quality remains the same.  Since they cook with water the calories are kept to a minimum.

lIT-EnFbI4zmv86b-KRfeQ.text: This place is affordable and delicious. Also they help you figure out the sauce to add to your dish. If you get the lunch special a small is plenty, trust me. You get rice and also a drink and soup with the lunch special too! Enjoy.

6d2nrcOQwy46LKjJrcJ_6Q.text: What more is there to say:    Meat = Good! Vegetables = Good! Noodles = Good! Sauce = Good! Soup = Good! Rice = Good!  Makes for one fat & happy Asian!

h5d5wDk0XraaW_t60ojCQA.text: So this is a follow up to my visit on 01/09/2018**  I went back to this establishment on 01/24/2018 around 4:00pm to give what had been one of my absolute favorite places to stop for a bite to eat another shot.   First and foremost I was greeted like I usually am by not one but two different hello and welcomes from the staff working that day. Julieta was the one that met me at the counter and as I have read in previous reviews her kindness and absolute professionalism was impeccable. Upon a brief conversation about my last visits she was very thoughtful and considerate and really went far above any customer service I had ever received at any establishment like this.  She really honestly made me feel like a valued customer and I honestly couldn't speak higher about the customer service she provided.    When I got to the food prep grill with my bowl in hand the cook greeted me with a kind hello and the issues I had the last two times were absolutely not at all present this time. The cook was very attentive with the food he was preparing,nothing was lost or wasted in prep, I honestly could tell the effort was being made. A tray was provided to allow me to move everything to a table, and of course the food upon completion was exceptional.   Everything about this visit was incredible and I could tell that all my issues previously had been addressed in a professional and timely manner. I highly,highly recommend.

s6_-C8N-O3GTAtgQMx8RiQ.text: Do you like fresh veggies?  Do you like your meat cooked on a mongolian grill?  Do you like to experiment with your type of sauces?  Then YC's Mongolian Grill is just for you!!  I love this place! I have been a fan for many years, and now it's just right around the corner from my office, making it another fast lunch time place!  For this trip , I grabbed a large bowl and a to go box, put some beef in the bottle of the bowl, hit it with some great looking veggies, didn't skimp on the mushrooms or onions either, piled on the wheat noodles, drizzled some hot chili oil on top, sprinkled some cilantro and pineapples on it, in a smaller bowl hooked me up some spicy Hunan sauce (which I make a tab bit more spicier than whats on the overhead menu, gave it to the guy and watch the magic happen while my lunch was being prepared! Walked to the side, grabbed a bowl of brown rice and some fried won tons & sweet sour sauce!   At this point, I halved my rice & bowl of food into the to go box to make sure I have lunch for tomorrow and lunch for today! Can't beat that! 2 meals, one price! Just word of advice, if you think you might need a to go box, get it when you 1st pay, it makes things easier! I promise!  Yum Yum YCs, looking forward to the next time I come back!

MesLDTLWhNheLrEERfgfMQ.text: Oooh I love this place.  I used to frequent the Tempe location on Southern and McClintock, but yesterday was my first time at this particular location.  It's extremely nice and spacious, definitely a lot newer than my previous haunt but they seemed a little understaffed last night.  Maybe it was because it was a Thursday night, but there was only one girl running the register, showing the newbies how the place worked, and cleaning the dining area, while the other girl was cleaning up.  Needless to say, most customers who came in had to wait a while before being rung up.  Now on to the good stuff, the food.  How it works:  You walk in, pay for your meal - about $13 for dinner, grab a tray and a bowl, and fill it up!  It's like a buffet of raw food.  First are the meats which are frozen and thinly sliced, but you're provided with little paper sheets to help you push down the food in your bowl and stuff as much as you want in the bowl.  Then the veggies will take up pretty much all the space left in your bowl (if any), and finally your choice of three different types of noodles.  Honestly, I think loading up your bowl is an art.  Especially when you get to the noodles and you're faced with this balancing act of piling noodles on your tray, I mean bowl.  You also get to mix up your own fantastical, magical concoction of sauces (I might be having too much fun here) which you will then bring to the chef with your bowl/tray of raw ingredients and they'll fry it up all up right in front of you!  After you get your bowl back, now transformed and cooked to deliciousness, head over and get yourself some rice, soups, chips, drinks, and later (it's hard to resist) ice cream!  I know what you're thinking, how in the world am I going to stuff this into my tummy?  Doggy bags.  $0.50 per box, but so worth it cause you will have food for days.  Okay, like another meal or so.  So if you're a college student who loves food but is short on cash or just love a good deal, YC's is gonna be your new best friend.

tRU3RKmrZ3WWEABhzno-Sg.text: First time going to YC's and the young lady at the front was so helpful. She explained the whole process to us and what she felt was the best deal. The only thing I wish YC's had more of was a variety of meats and other different sauces. Other than that I had no complaints. The store was very clean, staff was lovely, the food was amazing, and the experience was wonderful.

D7XetX_Tn-uKu8CZl_T-BQ.text: Came here for the first time and their food was delicious! I was confused on what to do since I hadn't been here before but everyone here was so willing to help! Price is fair for what they offer and their soups of the day were vegetable chicken and spices beef (both were awesome).

OFSTrMhcKziQrK94RbXHQg.text: We decided to give a different YC's a try & had a very pleasant experience. It was a week night that we went & it wasn't very busy in the restaurant. We were promptly welcomed in & got started through the line. The item buffet was clean & well-maintained which was very pleasing. Obviously as it wasn't too busy, we got our food very quickly & were ready to eat.  The price includes a bowl of food along with some other items such as soup & ice-cream. I opted to get the chicken & vegetable soup (not sure what the official name is but it was chicken & vegetables in broth ... tasted like chicken noodle without the noodles) .. It was kept warm & tasted good. The bowl was also good. It was my fault that I didn't put enough sauce in the bowl so there was some water sprayed on my food to cook it. I guess my only complaint was that the sauce flavors didn't come through as a result of that, but I still enjoyed the meal.  We will be coming back to this location!

JvCY32Fvkd7B3b7l7PlLHQ.text: This restaurant was yummy! It was entertaining to watch the men make the food on the round grills! Even the frozen yogurt was good. You have to pay extra for that though.

jeUzmHisb7d1RSLNMtP9Ng.text: Great service and great food, sorry no beer... but worth it all. What more can you say, it is excellent for the price.

h0SltF-gTx1LZ8t6WOdXRQ.text: This is my favorite place to go for lunch when I'm working. I get the beef soup and put lots of lemons in it! The people are very nice and they know what I want when I come in now. Always consistently good.

1_0De6CCUbWSoVVZVd8NbQ.text: Last night me and my lady went out to hit up a Mexican restaurant but we saw the line and kept on driving with no destination in sight. We happened upon YC's as there was a Taco shop nearby without a soul in the place so we decided to pass on the Taco's because no people in a restaurant scares the hell out of me.   We enter and a nice host explains to us how it works, we grab our metal looking dog bowls and proceed down the food line adding our raw goodies such as meats, sauce, veggies, noodles and the like. Smash it down smash it down, get as much in as possible into your doggie bowl!   We handed our bowls to the cooks and within a minute or two voila!, we had our tasty meals ready to go. Grab your own drinks, some rice and soup also if you like and enjoy your meal. Price was $13 or so for a large bowl, a couple dollars cheaper for a small. The large bowl I polished off with no problems and was nice and full while my girlfriend ate about half so you do the math. Will go back again most certainly and will try to smash it down even more. Yummy Chow!

WgQcM-2zKAzEBhAwEDMYHg.text: Walk in. Pay the cashier roughly $13 a person. Grab a silver bowl, a tray and some paper to mush as many ingredients into said bowl as possible. What the!? Meats include: chicken (white and dark), pork, beef, and a fish option. Maybe I'm forgetting one...? Oh well....move along and shove as many veggies as you can and then smush and stack as many noodles as you can on top. Up next, grab another smaller silver bowl and fill with any kind of sauce creation you could think of. Luckily the staff are ready and willing to help make your sauce. Then carefully waddle over to the cook and watch him "play hockey with your food". That basically means he puts your creation onto a giant, bazillion degree hot surface and uses these paddles to cook it all to perfection. After being amazed by the cooking process, stumble to a table and eat! Also included in the price: soft drinks and iced tea, two kinds of soup with wonton crisps, and white or brown rice. Wait! I forgot there is also chocolate and vanilla ice cream available! Wooo! There is a 50 cent charge for a to go container if you want to take your leftovers. If it's your first time, the container is free.  I will acknowledge that I had an upset tummy after eating here but I'm willing to give it another shot as it could have been unrelated. I wasn't in too much pain....haha

photos.caption: Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States

X1jhoYMOdw_YAInVTOiC3A.text: The ability to make your stir-fry with no surprise ingredients is a plus. You also get to season your build-your-own stir-fry with various sauces and oils -- but there are also suggestions of what flavors could go great with your selections.

StJEs5ufF-bREEiileoaEA.text: Other than paying for to-go bowls, the place is good. The food tastes great. Make sure to ask them to clean the cooking table before cooking your meal.

3qcyojkAyYDLXlmJ6VaEfQ.text: Fresh food, a lot to choose from, incredibly friendly and helpful staff. I would recommend YC's to anyone!

gAernlctGBtohNm3gmOkDw.text: One of my friends took my to YC's years ago during my time at ASU. I was skeptical and scared to try something new. Since then this has remained one of my favorite places to eat.  The place looks very confusing to new comers, so it's always good to go with a YC's veteran to show you the ropes. :) Take as much meat as you want, as much veggies, noodles and then it's up to you to make your own mixture of saucy goodness before handing it over to the good people that man the frying station. They have a plethora of great ingredients to make a delicious sauce for your stir fry. Ginger, Orange, Garlic, Sweet and Sour, and lots others. Above the cooking stations are steps to make different styles of sauce, but I always like going with my instincts and making my own. It's just more fun.   They also have soup, chinese noodles and white, brown rice to go with your meal and a drink comes with the cost. Love that.   I always leave full and usually have lots leftover to bring home. Its fun to get creative with your food here, watch it being cooked, and loving how it tastes. All for a great price. I can't say enough great things about YCs.

srLWNBbeg3tLnrZugBA7xw.text: The food was all right, nothing particularly special, but tasty nonetheless. It's the type of place where if a group of friends wants to go, I won't protest.  The service was okay, it depended on the person helping us down the line. The lady in the front was somewhat strange, she looked at us weird and acted awkwardly. She asked if we had been there before, and when we said no, she asked our friends, who had. She then proceeded to say that they could explain how the process work cause it was kinda long for her to do it. There was no one waiting behind us in line, so I thought that was a bit rude but not a big deal.   The idea behind the place is pretty cool! I've been to places like this before, but the selection of ingredients to put in your plate was very extensive in comparison.   The lady by the sauce station was very friendly and professional. She explained how to mix them and helped us out.   The cooking part is pretty cool. They have a round grill in which they spin your food around.   The portion sizes (if you fill your bowl up the right way) are a good size. It would not have felt somewhat pricy if I would have liked the food more.

h3SttV6CODnKHuPxxWG0YA.text: This place is my most favorite place in Tempe ! The food is always great especially with the spicy Hunan sauce. The prices are great because you get plenty of food for under 12 bucks a person not to mention the restaurant is super clean as well as the restrooms which a lot of establishments seem to have a problem with  ....bottom line is that YC's is the spot!

yRN55u0eUFz7eIryt7pRSQ.text: Way better than the one on Southern in Tempe. We love coming to YCs - fresh food, great flavors and good prices.

qw7GbyzEWLGe6JK-wldcRA.text: I love me some Mongolian barbeque!   Real Mongolian though. This is very very close. But for some odd reason it never comes out as mouthwatering as the ones from the buffets do when its cheaper too!  So every time i go to a YCS (which is not usual now) at the back of my mind as i am eating i think why did i come here this is so expensive for something that isn't as great as another place that is 2-4 dollars less for all you can eat?! YCS even charges for a to go box REALLY?! REALLY YCS?? You want to charge me because i actually got somewhat full? You can expect my presence to be scarce! It is a disappointment to me really. I would rather pay for all you can eat with mouth watering quality Mongolian than someone who charges for every little thing. What are you gonna do next YCS? charge for a ladle of soy sauce?! Jiminey Christmas!  UGH

s_6WaEWaKul6YYeI_skegg.text: Amazing service. I'm not gonna say the mistake they made but I will say that they took care of me and completely owned up for the mistake and I left with a smile on my face.

kGXGWoY6mDKF79RgCAuDRg.text: One of the best Mongolian BBQ chains in the U.S. and priced very reasonably!!!

pfeXMnKn4ubat0wF9wPHEQ.text: We used to come here all of the time, when it was cheaper. Over the last year the prices of YC's has jumped up over two bucks. That's way too large of an increase for just one year. It is now $11.50 to eat dinner here. Even the lunch prices are outrageous, $9.50 for one trip. We stopped coming in awhile ago just because of the prices.  I always liked the food though. Vegetarians FYI, there is seafood stock in the YC's own sauce. I didn't know that originally but found out a few months after being vegetarian after I contacted the corporate office. They told me that the fish sauce and the YC's own sauce are the only two sauces with animal ingredients. Their veggies always seemed decent though.  Here is a tip: If you pack your bowl super full, enough that you know you can't eat it all, get your food to go. I would do this and they would put all of my food in two containers and I wouldn't have to pay the extra $.50 for the take out container they charge.

8eCzAmAJimE_AqXm_122Hg.text: Does YC's stand for "yucky chinese?"   That's what I'm wondering as I am slowly trying to put down this food. This is such a fun and exciting concept, and the service was beyond amazing, but wow... this "food!" My sauce to meat/noodles/vegetables ratio is about 100:2. Being that you're supposed to choose your own food/sauce, including the amount, it should be my fault; however, the nice young lady who works there made my sauce. There's a menu board of how to make your sauces, but since there are two meal sizes you can choose from, I think they need to re-doctor those recipes to fit each of the sizes. I feel like I'm eating spicy soy and sesame sauce soup.    I think the price is pretty reasonable for everything you get: meal, drink, soup, great service.YC, re-doctor your sauce recipe and I may consider my return.

Z_IEX96jiJrLTsPgXQrtDg.text: The food here is great if you know what you're doing. I've been here many times and it took multiple times for me to figure out what flavors taste good and ones that aren't as good. Luckily they have a sign for your novices to follow on how to make your food. The staff is friendly and willing to help you if you need it. The portion is huge if you know how to pack your bowl down. Jump on that bad boy like a suitcase you are trying to pack tight. Don't be shy. For the amount of food you get plus a drink the price is fair. They normally charge 50 for a to go box but they've never charged me before. Depends on if they like you I guess. Just be friendly.

TsnZ16vtHoZtFxjc3O2RSA.text: We've gone to this place a couple of times and haven't been dissatisfied once. The overall joy of YCs is getting to fill your bowl a mile high with pure gluttony. The selection of ingredients was right on, the quality could leave some yearning but this is definitely a Quantity over quality establishment. No complaints on that part because I still found the food to be flavorful and fulfilling. The free ice cream at the end is a sweet added bonus and much appreciated.  I look forward to going here when I don't feel like cooking and like the experience of abundant selections and flavor options. Recommended highly:-)

lrACIwGwQvaJTZD5B8dYyQ.text: YC's is great in that you control the taste of your food.  The downside of that however, is that if you don't make a good flavorful combination, you're stuck with it (unless you go buffet-style).  At YC's they have a standard price for a bowl of stir-fry, but for an extra dollar you can have it all-you-can-eat.  The price they charge for a bowl includes drink and dessert, which is nice.  Unless you haven't eaten in days, I would recommend sticking to the single bowl since that is more than enough food for one person.   They have a pretty wide selection of meats, such as beef, pork, chicken, and turkey.  At dinnertime they bring out cod.  I do wish they had shrimp as one of the stir-fry ingredients though, since they have such a limited selection of seafood.  YC's has a good selection for vegetarians too, since they have a wide array of vegetables, and have tofu for those wanting a little more protein in their meal.    For those that prefer rice over noodles, they have white rice and brown rice at the counter where the soda fountain is.  They also have soup at the counter.  Once you've stuffed yourself silly with your own tasty concoction of stir-fry, you can head over to the ice cream machine for some soft-serve.  If you can't finish your meal, they do have take-out boxes, but they charge a small fee for them (a dollar I think).

Wk2LHoSQla4HXQ0rpbnUsg.text: This place is great! A coworker and I stopped in for lunch this afternoon and was blown away by both the food and staff.  You get a large bowl from the cashier and can personally stuff whatever meat, veggies and garnish you want. Then, mix a neat selection of sauces. Finally, watch the entertaining chefs cook your meal on a large heated stone.  Everything comes out fresh, hot and delicious! Want a tip? Use the wax paper next to the chicken to "stuff" your bowl. Everything will shrink when cooked and this will allow you to have a bigger meal for the same price.

AEnZfnUPncFYY5cup3LvBw.text: I have been to a buffet like this before, but I will never go to this particular one again.   The food all looked fresh as we went through the food line selecting our favorites and stacking our bowl to the sky. We selected our sauces and turned it over to the grill.   The cook doused our dishes with water, quickly cooked the ingredients, and returned them in a new bowl.   There is a selection of crispy wonton bits, rice and soups for you to add to your tray at no cost. I selected no rice as they were all old and burnt to the pan. I chose the hot and sour soup because it is ma favorite.   Free-range and refills on beverages.   Sat down to eat, was not impressed. I could not muster to try a second spoon of the soup as it was absolutely disgusting. The bowl of ingredients were all bland, perhaps from the overuse of water at grilling, and I am almost certain the tofu had gone bad, The slivers of meat that my husband had selected tasted fowl as well. We obviously did not get to far into our meal before leaving. Had we not already paid there would have been several complaints from me, and changes in selections.   We could have taken the left overs home, but opted to leave them instead.   Suffice to say, I do NOT recommend.

ZG4XPEffCx2sdIfb6Bz_cw.text: There are a lot of reviews of YCs and they seem to be pretty accurate but I will throw my opinion into the mix. YCs is a really fun place. All of the employees seem to really like working there and they are always exceptionally friendly.   The food portions are enormous if you pack it down into your bowl (I recommend doing son). Get a small bowl on the side for your sauce (you don't have to fit that into your mess of veggies and meat)! and that makes everything a lot easier.  As for flavor I think it's pretty good. I don't recommend going off in your own direction on the sauce, follow their recipes. Every time I've done one on my own it hasn't been as good.  If you like this concept though and want more for taste then go to Genghis Grill. The portion is slightly smaller but the taste is much better.

lN0rhnb1MecAdHmaIES8lw.text: I am a huge fan of YC's. I work right next to this location, so we frequent it for lunch. My favorite thing about YC's is not only the fact that the food is fantastic, but they let you pile the food as high as you can. It's always a competition amongst my co workers to see who can stack their food the highest. You just have to buy a $.50 cent to go box and you have lunch for the next day.   The staff is always super friendly, the restaurant is clean, and the variety of food never disappoints. I have absolutely no complaints for YC's.

UEAmjRQjBICn5mpqlznQ3A.text: I just love this place. Every time you go you can put a new twist on your meal by changing up the make-up of your sauce.   I always get a small bowl. You can still get way too much food and save money all at the same time.

Bl1SXBlgIODLhBVeVR0pww.text: This place really isn't bad. It just isn't great. If are going to go to any kind of chain restaurant then YC's is probably a good choice. You get to pick your raw ingredients and they cook em up for you right there. The food tasted pretty good but as far as the quality of the raw ingredients I wasn't very impressed.   I actually would recommend this place for someone looking for a very fast meal (since the wait time is close to zero), and it's True that it's healthier than a burger joint, but I guess my bar for "healthy food" is just much higher than this place.

ZJNEeqn-zW0un4z4zLJbTg.text: OK, this place has always been pretty good, and is great if you know the ingredients/flavors you like, but don't want to cook it yourself (Like at a Hot Pot place).  I have never written a review because I was eating there before I had ever visited Yelp, but recently they added a new "Thai Peanut Chili Sauce" and several seasonings that you can add to your food (IE: lemon pepper, cumin, and some combination spices).  This is a great improvement, and really increased my impression of their overall quality.  With these new improvements, I would say YC's is the best Mongolian BBQ I have personally had.

CBZ94cfPSi5TZybXZVUCXA.text: This isnt the worst food I have ever tried but I definitly will NOT be going back there anytime soon.  I dont know how fresh the vegetables are but it is a good alternative to fast food.  The meat is frozen and kinda grossed me out so I recommend the tofu, although I cant speak for its quality.  The service was fast and you get to decide how much of each ingredient you want.

KSjCj8r2ZlfWinkcWmiwzw.text: I've got a broken ankle so I'm staring at my walls for way too many hours each day. My sweetheart's been concerned for his safety so he's getting me out & about at least once a week. We (*I*) decided we should start trying out new places for food.  Last night he asks if I've ever been to a YC's. He'd been to one in CA years ago. I hadn't, so I checked out the reviews here, liked what I saw (especially the fact they were still open... Sunday night & I was starved!). Also found out it's less than a mile from home so even better... food... NOW!!  ** THE SERVICE **  Went in on crutches & the gal asked if we'd been there before... no, we haven't. We ordered 2 large bowls. She explained how it all works, even showed us how (& encouraged us) to smash as much food as we can into the silver bowls.   When we got to the spices, she came back & explained the menu board (if you find a mixture you like, you can repeat it the next time), asked me what flavors I preferred, & proceeded to help me (I told her what I liked... she put it in the bowl).  Once I had my all my ingredients, she carried my tray to the grill area for me & went back to help my man navigate the spices.  The guy at the grill tossed everything on top & started mixing it all together. It's always fun to me when I get to watch people cook my food!! I get to see how it's done (I suck as a cook but it's nice to know it CAN be easy!) & I know exactly where my food's been before I start eating... a win-win in my book!  In less than 4 minutes, I had a huge bowl of piping hot Asian food in front of me!! The nice gal came back & carried it to my table, got me 2 bowls of rice, a cup of iced tea, & an extra one for refills so I wouldn't have to have my man chase down more for a while.  NOTE: Don't expect this type of service!! As I said, I went in on crutches. Even then, I was still amazed at the extra help. I loved it because my man didn't have to keep interrupting his meal to make sure I had what I needed!!  ** THE FOOD ** I just can't say enough. The food is super fresh. The meats are shaved so you're not dealing with the chance of fat/grissle/ick that you sometimes run into at Asian food restaurants (yep, that'll ruin meals for me). You pick exactly the veggies you like (this is the first time EVER that I've had Asian food & haven't had to pick thru my food & end up throwing away half my meal!!).  AND, you get exactly the flavors & heat level you want. We're both super spicy people. But no matter where we order "extra spicy", we just don't get it. That didn't happen here! We both used the chili oil to what she called a "level 8" & you could actually taste the spice (next time I'm sure we'll be doing a 9 or 10, but it was really good at the 8 too).  ** PORTIONS ** I thought we'd done a good job at stuffing our bowls. But after seeing what others were doing, I know we can do better next time! LOL  But even with what we did, the bowls were full. He ate all of his... he's one of those guys who likes to feel full when he goes out & he was more than full when he finished. I ate about a third of my bowl & brought home leftovers that'll be good for another 2 meals for me!  They offer both brown & white rice. They have soup which I can't comment on since neither of us had any. And they have soft serve ice cream if you save room for dessert (how can you NOT save room for ice cream?!?). I got the twist kind with one of those tiny cones... VERY good!  ** CLEANLINESS ** The place was super clean. One of the gals was training a new gal & was literally wiping down ALL the walls. The tables were all clean. The guy at the grill was constantly cleaning the cooking area between customers. Everything you want in a food place!  ** PRICES ** Between the 2 bowls & the tip, we paid $30 for dinner. When I asked the gal for a takeout box, she let me know they normally charge 50 cents for them, but since it was our first time (so I didn't know to ask), she gave me one. For the amount of food, I'll pay the 50 cents!  We saw on the way out that we could get "Unlimited" for $1 more. We'll do that next time so he can have leftovers too!!  ** SIDE NOTE ** I asked my son this morning if he'd ever been to a YC's. He likes Asian food, but he's a super picky eater (aka doesn't eat any vegetables). So I figured it'd be an awesome place for him to go since he can pick and choose what's in his meal.   His text back to me? "It's f***in' amazing!" Really? He knew about this place and didn't tell me? I fired him as my food advisor!!  ** BOTTOM LINE **  We will definitely be going back soon!!

photos.caption: Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. It&#39;s like a giant flat wok... &#34;The Grill&#34;.
Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. My man&#39;s meal. Beef, noodles, kale, peppers, onions, corn, mushrooms, peanuts, broccoli and more. Full bowl and full man!
Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Lots of chicken, a bit of pork, noodles, broccoli, water chestnuts, peanuts, baby corn &amp; more. This was enough food for 3 meals for me!

G1iaH4drZw2EkW7RrREa4g.text: Clean and friendly, super cheap for the amount of food you can get. Load up your bowl as high as you can, buy a doggie bag and you basically get three meals for the price of one. Best part of this is, if the meal turns out bad, it's pretty much your own fault. You're the one that put all the ingredients together! Tons of options to choose from, you could do something different day for a month.

JN62RrDQ35hcoLUNIjNKxw.text: I absolutely LOVE Mongolian BBQ, and I REALLY want to love YC's, but I gotta knock the on their meats. They're incredibly Tough. Not sure where the cuts of meat are coming from, but in the 15+ times I've been there, I've never had tender meat! Super chewy, tough, unnngh.  Grab a handful of toothpicks on the way in!

VE2AJ_eKqjIx8rGz1ktUOw.text: There customer service is amazing. The young lady (Eileen) was super nice and answered our questions and offered assistance if we needed anything. Also Julieta was very helpful and approachable. Both the young ladies were on top of everything and took our dishes away quickly when we were done eating. My husband and I will definitely come back. Thanks YC'S for the great costumer service and food.

JEFeH3EgkQWCbatNx9fRcQ.text: By far the best experience I've had at any of these types of restaurants. I never feel like I know what to put together, particularly on the sauces. One of the employees here must have picked up on that, because she came over to ask me if I'd like help with the sauce. I said sure and she proceeded to ask questions about what we like. She came up with perfect combinations for me and my son. He ate his entire veggie stir fry, and mine was delicious. She came by while we were eating to make sure we liked them. We came in about an hour before closing and the restaurant was clean, the staff was friendly and I was pleasantly surprised. Hopefully I'll remember her concoction for next time, because we'll definitely be back.

KuEioO5MeqnseDpgO1AUrg.text: In my opinion, all Mongolian Grill's dehydrated/ freeze-dried protein and veggies are all basically the same. The distinguishing difference that makes or breaks the situation is "sauce game". In this occasion, the sauce game is relatively weak and it's clear that the staff knows that because they meet you when you get down to that point in the self-serve line where they jump in and try to assist you however the assistance still yields blandish un-flavorful finished product. A majority of the staff was friendly including Julia and Alicia and the manager guy however my noodle bowl was something that I could probably make at home. The chicken wonton soup was the highlight of the meal. Shame on the dish washer! It was quite an unpleasant interruption to the vibe when I had to go through the dishes to inspect for a clean bowl.

photos.caption: Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States

f7rQx0zky4QE3s9wcy60dQ.text: I remember coming to YC's as a kid.... I loved mixing all of the sauces and piling my bowl high with noodles and veggies.... I loved that they had soft serve ice cream...crispy wontons..... soup..... Well, nothing has changed! YC's is exactly as I remember it from years ago. The only thing that changed is it's actually a little pricey.... over 10$ even at lunch. Closer to 15 at dinner. Extra charge for a to go box (which is 100% necessary....trust me). Anyway, I loaded my bowl with all kinds of veggies.... added some of their weird freeze dried beef (it looks weird, but it tastes good, so who am I to judge)....piled noodles on top.... and poured on various sauces including a ridiculous amount of chili oil and garlic. Don't get me wrong, this is no authentic Asian food restaurant....but the flavor is pleasant regardless. Between my noodles, two different types of soup, and some wonton chips with sweet and sour sauce I was super stuffed and had two additional meals from the leftovers. I would definitely return...but probably only at lunch.

8hVT9eJayDOVqn6XqRgefA.text: Nice staff although not many of them. Not a lot of support or advice for newbies. Experience was unique but will not return.

RVCpjWGmISR97LVYDX0v_Q.text: My daughter and I decided to try this place and I'm so glad we did! We were greeted immediately by one of the friendliest young ladies who asked if we had been in before, and explained the process for us. After choosing our seats (we brought our own water cups in) we paid for our meal and moved our way through the wonderful selection of meat, veggies and noodles (EVERYTHING was fresh and looked amazing)! As I approached the sauces, the nice girl who greeted us appeared and asked if we would like help picking our sauces. After asking us what flavor profile we wanted, she very professionally ladeled the sauce combinations into a bowl and directed us to the chef who greeted us with a smile & "How are you today"? We watched him in intently as he cooked our dishes (with giant chopsticks!). Complimentary soup, rice, and some type of chip was also a nice addition. Our dishes were hot & DELICIOUS!! The hostess again came by to ask how everything was. Thank you for employing such nice, genuine, friendly staff. WE WILL BE BACK!

44T-nWguS1sbEv5ETT30OA.text: This location is very clean,they staffs customer service is great and they just remodeled! Went the other day and they also added new vegetables to the menu!

-hCfUkvsMilnuSgp1CDLNg.text: I have been to this location many times throughout my life and have always had a great experience. Today was different though, the service was exceptional! I even had a conversation with a lady at the fountain drink station who was overwhelmed/ impressed by Juliets outstanding work ethic. Any employer should feel blessed to have her on their team! Thanks Girl! =)

Wcg23atBgzZO5CUU1BGmVw.text: So after a long day of work and school, I was looking for a place to fill my appetite for something Asian. I looked through the restaurants near me and nothing new or of interest came up at first. I saw the pictures for YC's Mongolian Grill and my mouth started to water. Since it was only a couple of miles away from where I was, I decided to go check it out.  Walking in, I was definitely underwhelmed with the decor and overall ambiance. Nothing really blew me away visually, but I enjoyed the vibe of the restaurant. I was greeted by the person at the register and they explained to me how ordering worked. Since I was a newbie, I appreciated the hospitality. I paid upfront for my bowl and was directed to the buffet style food prep area where I could fill it with vegetables, noodles, and sauces. The price for the bowl was on the pricey side (about $12) for what I'm used to for noodles but considering how much food I packed into my small bowl it was definitely justified. There were people behind the food counter to answer any questions I had about some of the foods that I had not seen before and were very helpful. I especially appreciated the wide variety of vegetables they had considering I am a vegetarian. They had the meats and veggies separate from each other which earned them extra points in my book. After I picked out my vegetables and noodles, I was helped with creating my sauce. They had a menu of options I could mix together to curate my very own sauce that was unique and personable. I loved being able to control my spicy/savory/sweet levels in my noodles. The chef cooked it all up on a heated plate right in front of me which made the whole thing into an experience I hadn't seen before, and I went to my table after grabbing complimentary wonton snacks. The waiters were polite and checked up on me often, and even offered fountain drinks that were complimentary. The food itself was phenomenal (I partly pat myself on the back for creating such a good sauce) and the veggies tasted fresh and not frozen. I will definitely be coming back with friends for the value of the meal, the friendliness of the staff, and overall experience of being able to build my own meal.

x9Y-dLliDIczZT9ZDOQ-Zg.text: We would have had 5 Stars but what can a veggie eater expect when there is meat in the house.  Yep, I bit into a piece of burnt something. Now for the good part. Lots of choices and they give you ok to pile it one. Many options for seasonings and sauces. Rice bar and yogurt. Both are bottomless.   Folks stop in and go for it! Peace.

yAtGdkbj0M0DCVLZrnL4ww.text: This place is awesome. The food is great. You so many choices. My husband and I went for the all you can eat special. My mind was way hungrier than my stomach. E43qZx3N8h0yl5DCIX3Chw.text: First time at this YC's in Tempe. Much better experience than other locations around the valley.   The cashier was pleasant and helpful. She guided me to the food area and described the best way to dish up. Also, her station wasn't crowded right at the door front like other YC's.   The offerings were fresh, filled and inviting. They, like others, have a suggested sauce menu but this trip I just went crazy and tried a little of nearly every sauce. Should have stuck with the menu but it was still tasty.   The soup was strange. Plenty of beef, which is hard to find sometimes but the consume was a bit weak. Nothing a bit of soy couldn't fix. They also offered plenty of herbs and seasonings at the end, which was a nice touch.   I recommend this YC's to anyone who wants an easy, tasty bit of oriental cuisine. I was contacted (hadn't expected that) and was very impressed at the customer service and concern over my experience.  It restores some of my faith in customer service in general and in the care this manager had for his company.  I will give them another chance. 5 stars for this managers response and handling of the situation.

iRVmJKrplEgUkZ2qfA4evw.text: This is a great place to go for lunch or dinner.  Personally I recommend you stick to the menu items though.

7VKxk1HcoHdMQN6WXLr2nw.text: Good food, reasonably healthy, and good prices. I appreciate that they are concerned about and make accommodations for food allergies and intolerances. My daughter has a soy allergy, and the manager gladly told me everything that was cooked in soybean oil (most dressings). They also cook the food on the grill in sesame oil, which I appreciate. they cook the food and get it out very quickly.   Their kids meal would be a great deal for little kids. They give you a very small bowl and charge $.50 per year of the child's life. It wasn't nearly enough for my 10-year-old and would not have been worth $5, but it would be a great deal for kids 5 and under.

U7K124CQXF9_PZz0rRIo_w.text: I love this place! I always visit it when my wife is dragging me to Ikea.   Walking in you get to see the simple menu. They have options but all I see are the small bowl and large bowl options I opt for the large bowl. Cashier is always helpful and friendly and offers help if needed.   Walking up to the bar first comes the meats. They are shaved into thin meat slices so you gotta grab some wax paper sleeves and be ready to stack up the meat like you are creating Mount Everest! Don't worry about the weird looks you might get from other customers, real pros know you gotta work to stacks all the meat that you want.   Next comes the veggies, this can be a little difficult because they don't often stack as well so you gotta pick what you want well. Yes, use the wax paper to push it down!  Next come the noodles, and if you have done it right the. The noodles will be completely above the brim of your bowls and make everyone look and think "What is this guy doing?" don't you worry thought, you do you!  Then you have the sauce, they have chalkboards above the grill to suggest what you will need to pull off the flavor you desire. Make sure to grab one of the bowls above the the sauce station, this way you can have plenty of room for your sauce and not have it drip all over you. I suggest adding a couple scoops extra of sauce so that your giant food mountain has enough flavoring to go around   After all that is said in down now you hand it off the to the chefs and let them work your magic. Be sure to tip them, because what they do is art!   After it's all said in done it's now time to eat. Again, the staff is helpful if you need anything but otherwise it's time to enjoy the food.  If you've done it right then you will have plenty of leftovers, go ahead and pay that fifty cents for a to go box, it's worth it.   I highly recommend and suggest you go! No regrets!

Then the noodles, if you can fit any after you get the prior goods. Lastly, there were a wide variety of sauces. You take it to the cook then they put it on a round grill. Since I had it to go, they also gave me a carton for rice and a cup for a drink. I wish they would've given me a plate for it was difficult to eat it out of the carton.

My fave is noodles, chicken lots of different vedge and a sauce that is a take on the YC's. Wish they had one closer to where I live now though but it's very much worth the drive.

iV8hd9VjhbfJuToMovMqKg.text: I emailed YC's but did not receive a response.  I usually frequent the location at Gilbert and Germann but I was in Tempe so I stopped at this location.  When I paid for my food I asked the Yc's staff member if she could help me with my sauce (I never make it correctly).  The staff at the Gilbert location always offer to assist.  She was no where to be found when I was ready to make the sauce.  The bar was messy and when I brought my food to the grill to be cooked the staff at the grill looked visually annoyed to help me.  Also, the door was wide open to the back kitchen and there was an open view of the kitchen.  There was another YC's staff member who was moving uncooked noodles with his bare hands from one container to another.  Bare hands! I was super disappointed with this location because the Gilbert location is impeccable with everything.

JtLhCSCpU8m2BTIyNkqAKw.text: I always liked this place, making it the way I wanted. My disappointment is how much they raised prices and that they charge for To-go boxes $.50!?! WtH?Why??  Why on earth would you charge for To-go  it's not a buffet bar. It's $13 for lunch then you can't even take your leftovers?  Really horrible policy.

DSd3IpYSZCLMON7RL78v-w.text: I've been to list location many, many times over the years. We typically go on a weekend when it is less crowded. I avoid weekday lunch time crowds.   Food is typically good, but prices keep going up. For two of us on a Saturday evening is was $33 including the built in tip (suggested tip, that is) on the new fancy register system that many establishments seems to use now.  I doubt that our visit will be as frequent because it is pricey.  Consequently we smooshed whatever we could to make the most of it and got a to go box. (I think they still charge a $1 for one.) This way we could get more meals out of it and in my money conscience mind, if we can get more meals out of it, it brings the cost of a meal down.    There is one other thing that gets me because I'm a germ-a-phobe. People serve their veggies with large spoon. The spoon handles are frequently placed on top of the food itself. Does this mean their hand germs are on my food?  I try to appease myself by saying that whatever germs there are on the veggies is cooked off from the high temperatures. I"m not sure this is right but at least I can eat my meal. I don't know how this should be handled health wise or what the health department codes is, but I am cautious.   Service good, the establishment is clean and staff friendly. We will probably go here once or twice a year based on cost.

gI3tWuijKvhkjo8WuvW60Q.text: This is my favorite place to eat.
